>> Senate will come to order.

We've already done the prayer.
Unless you wanna pray again?
We can pray again.

>> We may need some more prayers sir.
We do, we need plenty of prayers Senator,
you are right.

Senator Lowe is recognized for prayer all members and guests in

>> [LAUGH]

Let us pray.
Thou art who at eternal gracious and kind.
We thank thee for this day,
we thank thee for this time and we thank
thee for this period of deliberation.
We ask that you'd be with each and everyone of us that we do our
best for the Old North State.
And all of the people said?
>> Amen.
[BLANK_AUDIO]
>> [LAUGH]
>> Senators we have a leave of absence
requested and without objection,
let's come to order senators,
granted for Senator
Hartsell [BLANK_AUDIO].
Senators upon the motion of Senator Brent Jackson Sampson County
the chair is happy to extend courtesies of the gallery to Johnny

Johnny if you are here with us in the gallery please stand to be
recognized

do you rise?
>> Motions please.
>> Senator Apodaca, you have the floor for your motions.

805 has been brought in?

a bill to

Submit the following report.

the

all in favor will

Moving on to public bills second reading.
Senate Bill 821 the Clerk will read.
>> Senate Bill 821 GSC Technical Corrections
Senator Apodaca is recognized to explain the bill.
>> Thank you Mr.
President, members.
This Technical Corrections bill is about as clean and technical
as we can get it.
We had great discussions and rules on this,
the first part came
from the general statutes commission,
the second part is Central
Staff driven list of technical corrections.
Mr.
President if I may I'd like to send forth an amendment.
>> You can send your amendment forward Senator.
Clerk will read.
>> It's there.
>> Senator Apodaca, moves to amend the Bill.
>> Senator Apodaca is recognized to explain the amendment.
>> Thank you Mr.
President, members I'm just gonna run through the list of What this
amendment does.
Item one at AOCs requests we've clarified when the term of one of
the current business court judges will expire.
Secondly, corrects statutory reference related to trust in a state
law.
Third makes a clarifying change to the student privacy
Act that we voted out earlier this session.
Fourth makes a changes to the Iran Divestment Act about when new
certifications to the Treasurers office are required.
Next it delays the moped insurance requirement until October 1st
to give industry time to write policies and work out potential
issues.
Next it makes clarifying change to our recent efforts on coal ash
to ensure that Duke energy provides three projects design to reuse
coal ash for beneficial use.
And lastly Ensures the Mohit school,
The Eastern School for the
deaf,and the North Carolina school for the deaf are expressly included
in the states mission to offer early intervention services to children
with disabilities.
I recommend the amendment to you,
be happy to answer any questions.
>> Do we have any discussion or debate on the amendment?
Hearing none, the question before the senate,is
the adoption of
Amendment 1.
All in favor vote aye,
opposed will vote no, five seconds will be
allowed for the voting,
clerk will record the vote.

>> Gun.
>> Aye 47 having voted in the affirmative and 0 in the negative
amendment one is adopted.
The bill as amended is back before the body Senator Apodaca is recognized.

50 to nothing, updating statutes,
the House added a provision to,
clarify how the industrial commission
initiates contempt proceedings and district court.

This is consistent actions that will resolve date overlaps,
Allow for minor road re-locations and utility easements and improve

>> I noticed a provision in this Bill dealing with certificates
of assumed names which are filed frequently by businesses when
they are operating under a name other than their incorporated name,
but one other things which I observed here is that while they're
establishing a new, for that,
it say s that all existing ones expire
on July 1 2022.
And the thing I did not know and perhaps is not a fair question
to ask of you because you're just here on providing some introductions
on this conference report,
but I'm trying to understand,
For all those businesses that we have in this state that operate
underneath certificates of assumed names,
how they will receive
notifications that they need to now go out and file a new one.
Cuz it's a lot of businesses out there that would fall into that
category.
>> Senator Mckissick, let's displace this Bill a moment and I'll

before we move forward.
>> Thank you.
>> Mr President, move that we remove this Bill place it end of the

file and tax returns.

President.
Many of you may remember,
cuz its been a while, we passed this bill
out of the senate
early in session, and it got over to the house and I guess,
had
some issues for some of them.
And they have worked on it and worked on it and they've sent this
back.
And what the bill basically does,
it came from the Military affairs
commission and what it does is try to help us get account of how
many military or retired military are employed in the state of
North Carolina.
As we try to become the most military friendly state.
This is a start, I think the bill can use some work but at this
point I'd ask that you concur and I think all the parties have
agreed to this particular version of it.
>> Senator Brown asks you concur do we have further discussion or
debate?

>> Thank you Mr President.
Members, house bill 992 basically is just a technical correction
to the Hemp Bill we passed last year senate Bill 313,
and basically
what it does it actually clarifies the commission's work and the
department of agriculture framework of how they wanna set up the
scope of the industrial hemp commission as well as it allows for
a few more members,
to be appointed to the commission so that they are relative such
as different types of soil scientists and experts that are know
in the knowledge of trying to raise this new crop and basically
that's pretty much it.
The Bill goes into detail how this commission,
will work, but there's
nothing in here that is really outstanding,
It gives the industrial
hemp the ability to have rule making authority such as the board
of agriculture currently has and I'll be glad to entertain any
questions you might have but I would as for your support of this
Bill, Thank you.

[BLANK_AUDIO]
House Bill 742, the clerk will read.
>> House Bill 742 clarify PE licence,
>> Senator Tucker is recognized to explain the bill.
>> Yes sir.
Thank you Mr.
President.
This is a house bill that came over currently,
the way the PU licensure
process goes, you're required to get an engineering degree.
And you're required to pass the fundamental examination and then
you're required to get four years of experience and then finally
take the PE exam to get your licensure.
What this does is simply change the sequence of the licensure and
it allows someone to come out of college,
go ahead and take the
fundamental test and go ahead and take the PE test when they are
in an academic frame of mind and pass it as they recently get out
of school and then they must obtain four years of experience,
and
then at that time they can get their PE license so it doesn't have
anything to do with licensing other than the requirements other
than allowing the sequence to change.
that is that piece of it and then on the other side of it Senator
Bingham had a situation in his county where farmers were hard to
find.
And so we're working with the [INAUDIBLE] Heat and Air conditioning
Board he developed language that would allow local board of education
to employ a licence plumber to perform maintenance and repairs
on school property so no opposition from one of this industrial
support thank you.
Any further discussion or debate?
Senator Davis what for purpose do you rise?
Mr.President I'd like to ask senator Tucker a question please.
>> Senator Tucker do you yield for a question?
>> I do.
>> Senator Tucker could you tell the chamber what career opportunities
are available for those people who flanked the engineering exam.
>> Yes sir, as was stated by me in committee
Those who flanked the fundamental exam coming out of college may
then apply to become Orthodontists,
thank you.
[LAUGH]
>> Senator Tillman for what purpose do you rise?
>> You know I almost forgot to ask senator Tucker a question.
>> Senator Tucker do you yield?
>> Reluctantly yes sir.
>> School system employee plumbers those in maintenance ,
they have
a licensure that's owned by the board of education so they can
do school projects I believe that's correct I'm I not?
>> Yes you're correct the licensure is under the school.
>> All right now if they want to come go out another question a
series of questions.

Tillman.
>> yes sir I do.
>> If the said planner for the school system wants to
moon light and go over and fix the problem with this members houses
etc, can they now do this under the bill?
>> Yes sir they can very good sir thank you.
>> Any further discussion or debate?

House bill 805, clerk will read.
>> House bill 805, measureability,
assessment, budget tech correction.
>> Senator Jackson is recognized to explain the bill.
>> Thank you Mr President.
Members the first part of this bill,
I'm gonna have to go for my
note, but the second part is our budget technical correction bill
and I can go in that in a little more detail.
The first part of this bill will require the PED or program evaluation
division to identify and contract with an independent measurebility
assessor to evaluate current or propose state programs when requested
by the General Assembly.
And as it was explained in the appropriations committee earlier
this morning basically the house members said that this was when
a request is to to do a state agency that is not always prudent
to have her own folks here
at the General Assembly do it without working with another assessor
and basically that's what this bill the first part of this bill
would do.
And I can go into more detail if you like but that seems to be pretty
much the jist of what this bill does.
And then for the budget technical corrections I'm gonna just hit,
I would have to say one I wanna thank staff both Mark and Karen's
team for all they've done on this with the budget and so forth
this year.
But we have probably got the smallest correction bill that I've
ever had the opportunity to work on since I've been up here in
2011 and so I'm gonna just hit the really the substance of the
things that are what I considered to be significant and the rest
of them are basically just technical fixes to the budget.
Section 4.3 adds a reporting requirement to the principal preparation
grant program and adjustes the administration call stipulations.
Section 5.4 directs the DHHS to consult with DPI when studying
for funding for slots for the NC preK program.
Section 643 [INAUDIBLE] department of Agriculture use 10% of the
healthy quarter store/g initiative money for administrative purposes.
Section 8.1 transfers 5000 nonrecurring from the emergency response
and disaster funds sto the governor office for litigation associated
with House Bill 2, this was the governor's request.
Section 9.1 provides a community college system with more flexibility
for funds they receive for compensation increases.
Section 10.2 lets DOA department of administration lease land to
a third party for a training facility here in Raleigh on Peach
street.
And the rest of it basically is just purely technical in nature.
I do have an amendment that I would like to run at this time Mr
President and it should be on the dashboard.
>> Okay we have that senator.
Before we do that, just a couple of quick announcements before we
do the amendment
Senator Jeff Jackson has leave of absence for the remainder of this
session, and at this time we would also like to dismiss our pages.
They are at the end of their tenure here with us for the week.
Let's also say thank you to them for a very long hard week.
Thank you pages.
>> [APPLAUSE]
[APPLAUSE]
>> Clerk will read the amendment.
>> Senator Jackson moves to amend the bill.
>> Senator Jackson is recognized to explain the amendment.
>> Thank you Mr.
President, let me make sure I got it from the dashboard.
Yes sir.
Okay basically the amendment is what it says it does,
what we've
done we had appropriated $700,000
to try and renovate a gym at
Tarheel ChalleNGe in Salemburg,
and came to find out the gym was
in such delapitaed condition and then [INAUDIBLE] to me the gym
had already torn down.
So this basically
as allowing them as a fund code shift of the money.
There's no additional money being added,
it's just a fund code shift
to allow them to use this money for new construction when they're
at the appropriate time that they can,
and I would ask for your
support.
>> Do we have any discussion or debate on the amendment?
Hearing none the question before the senate is the adoption of amendment
one all in favor will vote aye,
oppose will vote no.Five seconds

the bill as amended is back before the
body.

>> Senator you can send forth your amendment.
The clerk will read.
>> Senator Brown moves to amend the bill.
>> Senator brown is recognized to explain the amendment.
>> Thank you Mr.
President.
Members this amendment really addresses an issue that
It was on last years budget,
as you know when a transportation does
projects throughout the state,
they try to work with cities as
it relates to moving utilities.
But we changed the date in last years budget at the very end and
one town in North Carolina Lenoir got caught in a situation where
DOT has refused basically or did refuse to pay their share of this
utility movement on a highway project.
This fixes and we'll refund the town of Lenoir the DOT share of
that particular project.
That's what it does.
>> Do we have any discussion or debate on the amendment?
Senator Ford for what purpose you rise?
>> See if senator Jackson yield for a question.
>> Senator Jackson do you yield?
>> Yes or I'll attempt to.
>> Is it Senator Brown on the amendment?
>> Senator Brown.
>>Senator Brown do you yield?
>> I do.
[LAUGH]
Thank you sir for your willingness to stand in for the question.
Can you tell
us how much the amount is?
>> Senator Ford I think it's $750,000
I think the project was a
little over a million,
and it's in a major intersection in Lenoir
>> Follow up.
